Key Match Events: Bangladesh were limited to 127 for eight from their 20 overs
Babar Azam and Mohammed Rizwan put on 57 for the first wicket
Mohammed Haris played another thrilling cameo, worth 31 from 18 balls
Pre-Game Insights: Neither side would have expected to still be in contention by the time they travelled to the ground
The match became a knock-out tie after the Netherlands beat South Africa
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan will play in the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup after a stunning Sunday in Adelaide
Shan Masood provided the cool head when it was required, clipping the two runs required to seal a famous win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Netherlands beat South Africa in the opening game of the day, rendering the subsequent match a knock-out tie
The match was played on a worn wicket, which made sense for Bangladesh to have first use
Others: Ian Smith termed the Netherlands' 13-run win over South Africa as 'one of the biggest upsets in world sport in a long time'
The decision to dismiss Shakib Al Hasan was upheld, despite his review
